If the message is too long, you'll split by ====== to 3 messages

nodes.name: Sticky Note

parameters.content:
## YogiAI

This YogiAI is to provide daily reminder and pose of the day to the user via Line Push Message

The data will be generated from GoogleSheet Weighted Random Poses and Push to your Line at the scheduled time

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note1

parameters.content:
## Get the Data
This is to get the data from GoogleSheet 

In the range we got, we'll have PosesName, uri (image link), and url (link when clicked) 

The sample is here 
{{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}

The data is from {{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}

***YOU SHOULD UPDATE IT WITH YOUR OWN DATA***

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note2

parameters.content:
## Write FlexMessage for Images

To send the information in Line, we need to write a JSON for Flex Message meaning that it can slides to show the images of the pose

We use auto-parser here to make sure the JSON followed the required format

{{ $env.API_BASE_URL }}

You can also use {{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }} to simulate the format

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note3

parameters.content:
## Write Text for Poses today 

This node we want to have user friendly text such as with emojis, etc. So, we give Azure OpenAI the poses of today and ask it to rewrie

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note4

parameters.content:
## Combine the result and push it via Line

1) We used 'Edit Field' to combine all the output
(Hint: you can have input_txt and output_txt to debug your script here)
2) To make sure that our JSON is proper, we asked AI to fix it again. 
3) Use Line Push >> Please replace "to" to your own UID and create the header authorization with the channel you have

{{ $env.API_BASE_URL }}

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note5

parameters.content:
## Write back the data into Log and Log2 

We used log2 to count how many time we send each poses and weighted this back into the 'Yoga' Sheet to make the random more random ;)

To put the data back, we also want to extract from the output and split it out to put back to google sheet

nodes.name: Workflow Documentation

parameters.content:
# YogiAI

## Overview
Automated workflow: YogiAI. This workflow integrates 14 different services: stickyNote, httpRequest, code, scheduleTrigger, agent. It contains 44 nodes and follows best practices for error handling and security.

## Workflow Details
- **Total Nodes**: 44
- **Node Types**: 14
- **Error Handling**: ✅ Implemented
- **Security**: ✅ Hardened (no sensitive data)
- **Documentation**: ✅ Complete

## Node Breakdown
- **Azure OpenAI Chat Model2**: lmChatAzureOpenAi
- **YogaLog**: googleSheets
- **Azure OpenAI Chat Model3**: lmChatAzureOpenAi
- **Auto-fixing Output Parser**: outputParserAutofixing
- **Azure OpenAI Chat Model1**: lmChatAzureOpenAi
- **Structured Output Parser**: outputParserStructured
- **AI Agent**: agent
- **PosesDatabase1**: googleSheetsTool
- **YogaLog2**: googleSheets
- **Split Out**: splitOut
- ... and 34 more nodes

## Usage Instructions
1. **Configure Credentials**: Set up all required API keys and credentials
2. **Update Variables**: Replace any placeholder values with actual data
3. **Test Workflow**: Run in test mode to verify functionality
4. **Deploy**: Activate the workflow for production use

## Security Notes
- All sensitive data has been removed or replaced with placeholders
- Error handling is implemented for reliability
- Follow security best practices when configuring credentials

## Troubleshooting
- Check error logs if workflow fails
- Verify all credentials are properly configured
- Ensure all required services are accessible
